title: I am directing the Department of War to designate Anthropic a supply-chain risk
author: jacobedawson
aiHeadline: The Department of War is now treating Anthropic like a potential threat, because apparently their AI models are 'too good' and might be used for... something. Who knows? Maybe world domination? Or just better customer service.

title: The Hunt for Dark Breakfast
author: moultano
aiHeadline: The Hunt for Dark Breakfast: Because apparently, breakfast is now so dark, even the NSA couldn't find it. Who knew scrambled eggs could be this elusive?

title: Court finds Fourth Amendment doesn’t support broad search of protesters’ devices
author: hn_acker
aiHeadline: Court rules that the Fourth Amendment still matters, even when it comes to protesters' devices. Spoiler alert: the government can't just waltz in and search everyone's phones because they're mad about a protest. Shocking, right?

title: Get free Claude max 20x for open-source maintainers
author: zhisme
aiHeadline: Get free Claude access (max 20x) for open-source maintainers: Because who doesn't love getting something for free, especially when it's for doing something you already love? Now you can code and chat with AI all day long. What could possibly go wrong?

title: Dan Simmons, author of Hyperion, has died
author: throw0101a
aiHeadline: Dan Simmons, author of Hyperion, has died: The sci-fi world has lost one of its greatest storytellers. His work will continue to inspire and terrify readers for generations to come. Rest in peace, Dan.
